quote: The Saratoga put in this morning.
We are not having another party.
I promise not more than fifty or   sixty...
I can see it now. Two hundred    people jammed into our quarters...    eating, drinking...       ... laughing.
Sounds awful. What if I promise    you there'll be absolutely no    laughter?
No, I mean it. You won't see a    single smile the entire evening.    It'll be the grimmest party you've    ever been to.
No smiling -- or you won't be    invited.
When do you want to have this    party?
Next week. And I was thinking...    maybe we should give the evening    a theme.
What kind of "theme?"
Why don't we have everyone come    as their favorite Klingon?
Bad idea?
Commander -- your holosuite is    ready.
Good.
Have fun exercising.
No party?
(holding up her thumb    and index finger)   Came this close.
Thank you, Quark.
Don't mention it, major. I'm glad   I could be of help.
Bajoran lilacs.       Is something going on between you   two that I don't know about?
Don't be disgusting.
I ordered them for myself.
That's nice.       I thought you didn't like flowers.
I don't.
I'm confused.
Jadzia -- there's such a thing as    privacy.
Not between friends.
It's my mother's birthday. She    would've been sixty today.        My father always said these were    her favorite.
What a nice way to remember your    mother.
I wish I did remember her. I was    only three when she died in the    refugee center.
I'd bet she'd be proud of you --    of what you've done with your life.
I'd like to think so. I've always    been proud of her. My father    always said she was the bravest    woman he knew.
Major Kira. You have an incoming    transmission.
From whom?
Unable to identify.
Put it through.
Ah, major -- there you are. I'm    sorry to wake you.
What the hell do you want, Dukat?
Don't bother, major. I guarantee    you won't be able to trace this    transmission.
Then why don't you just tell me    where you are?
Because that's not why I called.    I want to help you, major -- the    way Captain Sisko helped me.
I don't know what you're talking about.

Captain Sisko gave me the clarity    to see beyond the lies... the self-   deceptions that were controlling    my life. He helped me see the    truth about myself.         And now I'm going to do the same    for you.
And what better day to do it than    on your mother's birthday.
Is that suppose to upset me? That    you know it's my mother's birthday?

She was a striking woman, your    Mother. Though when I met her,    she was very self-conscious about    that small scar along the side of    her face. She used to try to    cover it up with a strand of hair.
Nice try, Dukat. But you never    knew my mother. She died in the --
-- in the Singha refugee    center? I'm afraid not, Major.    That was something your father    told you because he couldn't bear    to face the truth.
What truth?
That your mother left him to be    with me.
You're lying.
Your mother and I were lovers    almost from the moment we met.    And we remained lovers until the    day she died.
I've had enough of this --
I see you have lilacs on your    nightstand. Your mother would be    touched -- she loved Bajoran lilacs.        There... I told you the truth was    liberating. Now, don't you feel    better? I do.
Computer. Locate Cardassian    occupation files, Singha refugee    center. Find and display Bajoran    identity profile for Kira Meru.
Then you're just going to have    to take my word for it, Julian.    he battle at the Alamo would make    a helluva holosuite program.
Raktajino.
Let me get this straight...    there's two hundred of us, trapped    inside some crumbling, old    mission... surrounded by two    thousand enemy troops?
That's right.
And we win?
No, we lose.
Why on Earth would you want to    play a program where we lose?
You're missing the point,    Julian -- there's nothing more    noble than a heroic defeat,    especially against overwhelming    odds.
In life -- maybe. But not in the    holosuites.
Chief -- you were suppose to have    finished recalibrating the    induction modulators yesterday.
We had a little problem replacing    some of the coil brackets --
Save the excuses. I want it done    within the hour.        Doctor, is there a reason for your    visit?
Actually, Miles and I were just    chatting about --
I thought not. If you don't mind,    we're on duty.
Don't let me interfere.
All right, everyone -- this isn't    the Replimat. We're not here to    drink raktajino and catch up on the    latest gossip. Let's get to work.
Odo, I've just been informed about    the increased criminal activity    on the Promenade.
It's not as bad as it sounds,    major. We're only talking about    a few incidents of petty theft.    I've already assigned two    deputies --
-- I'd prefer you handle the    matter personally.
If you think that's necessary.
I do. And make sure I'm kept    informed of your progress.
Of course.        Is there something else on your    mind?
Meaning what?
Meaning I spoke to Doctor Bashir    earlier and he mentioned you    seemed... irritable. I can see    he wasn't exaggerating. Care to    tell me what's bothering you?
I appreciate the offer, Odo. But    I really don't think talking about    it is going to help.
Sounds serious.
It is.
Then if you won't talk about it...    perhaps you should consider doing    something about it.
A transmission from Dukat? This    is the first I've heard of it.
That's because I didn't report it.
Why not?
It was of a personal nature. I    tried to trace the signal, but...
What did he want?
He said he knew my mother... that    they were lovers.
You don't believe him, do you?
He knew certain things about    her... personal things.
Dukat is a very resourceful man.    I'm sure he knows a lot about your    family... about all our families.
I keep trying to tell myself that.    But I need to know.
That may not be possible.
There is one way. I could visit    the Temple of Iponu on Bajor and    consult the Orb of Time.
Excuse me?
I need to know the truth.
Let me get this straight... You    want to travel back in time to see    if Dukat and your mother were    lovers?
That's right.
I'm sorry, major, but the    Federation has strict    regulations --

-- this has nothing to do with the    Federation. I need your help as    the Emissary -- not as a Starfleet    captain. The Emissary can see to    it that I'm allowed access to the    orb. After that, it's up to the    Prophets...
... if they feel my request is    worthy, they'll send me where I    need to go. If not... then I've    made a trip to Bajor for nothing.
And if they do send you back...    what then? How can you be sure    you won't interfere with the time    line?
The Prophets will be guiding me.    Nothing will happen without their    blessing.
Please, Emissary -- let me seek    the will of the Prophets.
Meru! I found Nerys.
scene: 16   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: Where was she?
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Wandering over there, scrounging    for food.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: That's all? It's barely half a    cup.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: They've cut everyone's rations.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: It's not enough. How do they    expect us to survive?
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: The Cardassians don't care whether    we survive or not. They won't be    happy until we're all dead.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Come my sweethearts -- drink your    soup.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Excuse me.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: That soup... it's ours.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: What are you talking about? My    wife stood in line all day to get   it. If you think you can just --
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Just what?
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: It's for the children -- they're   hungry.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: We're all hungry.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: That's right, we are.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: And hunger can make people do    stupid things.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Like what you're doing now?
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: The Cardassians are the enemy.    We shouldn't be fighting amongst    ourselves. we should be trying    to help each other...
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: That's what we were doing...    helping ourselves to some soup.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: If you want soup, you'll have to    get in line like everyone else.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: We may have to take orders from    the spoonheads, but we don't have    to take them from you.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Thank you. I wish we could repay    your kindness somehow... but we    have so little food.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: It's all right. I'm not hungry.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: I can't remember the last time I    met a Bajoran that wasn't hungry...        I'm Kira Meru.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: I'm... I'm just glad I could help.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: This is my husband, Taban. Our    sons, Reon and Pohl, and our    daughter, Nerys.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: They're beautiful...
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: My daughter wants to know your    name.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Me?        I'm Luma Rahl.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: It's nice to meet you, Nerys.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Attention!
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: The new Cardassian Ore Processing    Center orbiting Bajor is nearing    completion.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: The Cardassian troops stationed    there will require "comfort women"    to make their tour of duty less...    stressful.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Her.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: As of now, you'll receive extra    rations of food and medicine.    Courtesy of our Prefect, Gul Dukat.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Her.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: No!
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: And her.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: But my children --
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Your children will eat better than    they have any right to.        Let's go.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: Meru!
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: I love you.    (a last look to the     children)   Don't let them forget me.
scene: 23   INT. SINGHA REFUGEE CENTER - BARRACKS - NIGHT

quote: You will find food in your    quarters. Eat as much as you want    and make sure you get a good    night's rest. You'll want to look    your best tomorrow.
And feel free to linger as long    as you want in the sonic showers.    Cardassians value cleanliness.
Meru, listen to me -- I know    things look bad, but don't give    up just yet... we'll find a way    out of here.
How?
There must be a resistance cell    operating on the station. We'll    contact them. They'll help us get    away.
I don't believe it...
Fresh moba.
Do you know how long it's been    since I've seen fresh moba?
Nice.
Nice? Look at all this...    katterpod beans, hasperat,    veklava, a pot of deka tea... we    could live on this for a year!
Easy. You don't want to make    yourself sick.
Sick from too much food? That    would be a change.        I only wish Taban and the children    could be here...
(trying to convince     herself)    The Cardassians said they'd take    care of them... maybe they will.
I wouldn't count on it. We need    to find away off this station.    Once we do that, we can figure out    a way to free your family.
Then what?
We hide up in the hills.... join the    Resistance.
I suppose it's possible...
Of course it is. We just need to    bide our time.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to...
I failed to show a Cardassian    soldier the proper respect.
We all have scars. Of one kind    or another.
Maybe. But most aren't quite    so... evident.
It's not that bad.
Why do you keep doing that?
What?
Helping me. First, at the refugee    center and now here...
I don't have many friends.
Well, you have one now.

Well done. I can hardly believe    that you're the same women I met    yesterday.       In fact -- you're not. Your old   lives have ended. Your pasts have   been erased. You have one purpose   and one purpose only: to provide   comfort and care to the Cardassian   officers stationed here. Do that   well, and you'll want for nothing.   Fail, and you and your family will   be sent to a labor camp.
(he lets that sink in     for a moment)    Now remember -- you're all easily    replaceable. Make one mistake and    I won't hesitate to --
Basso!
Enough.

Welcome to Terok Nor. I hope your   stay here will be a pleasant one.   I assure you, I will do everything   possible to make it so. I suspect   that many of you must be feeling   a bit uneasy right now... I'm well   aware that among the Bajoran   population there's a perception   that all Cardassians are to be   feared -- that we're a cruel and   heartless race. I hope to dispel   that myth, not with words, but   with actions, in the hope that you   will come to appreciate the better   part of our nature.
I assure you that we are capable    of great kindness.
What of our families? Are they    all right?
Who said you could speak? Guards!
Stay where you are.        Your families will be well taken    care of.
That, I promise you.
What's this?
Basso.
Forgive me, Prefect. I didn't    notice the imperfection. I'll    have her removed at once.
Get me a dermal regenerator. Now.
I'm afraid to ask how you came by    such a... mark.
It's nothing.
On the contrary, it's an    unfortunate reminder of the gulf    that exists between our two    peoples.
It must be removed immediately.
There.        Beautiful.
Carry on.
I'd say congratulations are in    order. You've all passed your    first test.
Would you mind telling me what    you're smiling about?

The Prophets. I never realized    they had such a sense of humor.    When I was a child, I would dream    of having enough food to eat and    pretty clothes to wear.        And now, look at me... I have    everything I ever wanted...       ... and I feel horrible.
It is kind of funny... in a    horrible sort of way.
I suppose if I can survive    starvation, I can survive this...
After all, we're Bajorans. We can    survive anything...
You!
Think you can stand there hiding    in a corner all night?
I don't remember seeing you before.
I just arrived yesterday.
And I bet I know what you're    thinking... you'd like nothing    better than to get us all drunk    so you could kill us in our sleep.
Are you sure you're not part    Betazoid?
Come. Sit on my lap and tell me    how much you hate Cardassians.
You Bajoran women... you're all    so bony.
That's because you Cardassians    have been eating all our food.
You know I could have you executed    for that kind of insolence.
Which is one of the reasons we    hate you so much.
Clever girl. Now pour me some of    that kanar and let's see if we    can't work out our differences.
I said, let her go.
All I said to her was --
I don't care what you were    saying -- it's what you were doing    I don't like. Now get away from    her.
Are you all right?
Escort this woman back to her    quarters. See that her privacy    is respected.
No one will disturb her.
I only hope you won't condemn us   all for the boorish behavior of   one man.
I only hope you won't condemn us   all for the boorish behavior of   one man.
How'd you know he was going to say   that?

Let's just say this is not the   first performance I've seen of   this little melodrama.       That woman should consider herself   fortunate. She's caught the   Prefect's eye. As of now, she's   off limits to the rest of us       As for you...
I know, I know... another glass    of kanar.
For starters.
That's right... just put one foot    in front of the other.
Don't tell me what to do... I'll    put my feet wherever I want. I'm    a Cardassian.
Whatever you say. Just try not    to stumble out of any airlocks on    your way home.
I'm not going home -- I'm coming    in with you.
No, you're going back to your    quarters and going to sleep.
I want comfort and I want it now.    You're a comfort woman, aren't    you? You're dressed like one...
Don't be fooled by appearances.
That mouth of yours is going to    get you in trouble someday.    (trying to push past     Kira)    Now let's go get some sleep.
I have a better idea. You sleep    in your quarters and I'll sleep    in mine. And tomorrow...
... tomorrow you'll be all mine    to do with as I please.
I can hardly wait.
Meru, I'm back.
I'll need to shower for a week to    get the smell of that legate off    me --
I'll be sure to tell him you said    that.
What are you doing here? Where's    Meru?
Looks like you're going to have    these quarters all to yourself --    at least for a little while.
I said -- where's Meru?
She's moving up in the world.    Your friend must have hidden    talents I wasn't aware of. Our    beloved Prefect has "invited" her    to share his quarters.
I want to see her.
Do you?
Now -- take me to her.
Tell me, how's work going on the    Ore Processing Center?
You ought to join the work detail    sometime -- find out for yourself.
All in good time. Once the center    is up and running, we'll all be    slaving away down there.
(softly, so as to not     be overhead)    I have some news for you.
About my friend?
I know why you haven't heard from    her these last few weeks. She    hasn't been on the station.
What are you talking about?
Word has it she's been off on a    little "vacation" with Gul Dukat.    They just got back today.
Why's that woman so important to    you? She's nothing but a    collaborator.
She's not a collaborator.
She's a comfort woman for the    spoonheads, isn't she?
So was I.
For a day. But I've been watching    you. You have no love for the    spoonheads.
Neither does my friend. Now I    already told you, I don't want to    join your resistance cell, so why    don't you just leave me alone.
I will, I promise. But first, I    need you to draw a map for me.
A map of what?
The Cardy side of the station.
Like you said, I was only there    for a day.
Whatever you can remember will be    helpful. Quarters, corridors,    meeting rooms...
Why? What are you planning?
That doesn't concern you. Now are    you going to help us or not?
You.
Follow me.
You may enter.
Luma!
Are you all right?
I've been worried about you ever    since that night they took you    away.
I know. I wanted to get a message    to you...
Has he hurt you?
Who?
Dukat.
Hurt me?    (shaking her head, how     to explain)   No, he hasn't hurt me.
I wish I knew how to explain these    last few weeks to you... make you    understand.
Understand what?
That I'm not the monster you think    I am.
You see? I told you I'd find a    big enough vase.
What do you think?
They're beautiful.
I don't think your friend approves    of the flowers... or of me.        Are you sure this is the woman you    want as your companion?
Yes.
As you wish.        The fact is, I've treated Meru    with nothing but kindness and    consideration. If you don't    believe me, ask her.
I'll be back as soon as my meeting    is over.
It's true. He's very different    from what I expected.
Don't let the smile fool you --    he's still the enemy.
It's not that simple.
Yes, it is.
Meru, listen to me... while you're    in here playing parlor games, he's    busy carrying out the extermination    of our people.
That's not true -- he's written    to the Central Command urging them    to rethink their policies toward    Bajor.

I wouldn't care if he played you    a holo-recording showing him on    his hands and knees begging the    Central Command to end the    Occupation -- it would still be    a lie. Like that first night,    when he "saved" you from that Gul.    That wasn't real. He set the    whole thing up to win you over.
He told me. He tells me    everything. You just don't know    him...
I don't have to -- I know the    things he's done.
Look what he's done to you! He    took you away from your family --    from your children.
He's promised to help them -- to    see that they're given food and    medical supplies.
That still doesn't make it right.    What about your husband? Taban    loves you. How can you forget him    so quickly?
I haven't forgotten him. What do    you expect me to do -- kick and    bite every time Dukat comes near    me? How would that help Taban or    the children?

Is that what you're telling    yourself? That you're doing all    this for the children? The    clothes, the food... the easy    living? It's all for them? Are    you that deluded?        This isn't for them -- it's for    you. You like it here. You enjoy    playing house with that murderer.        Don't you see what you are... what    you've allowed yourself to become?    You're a collaborator.
A collaborator? Because I share    Dukat's bed?
No -- because you like sharing his    bed...       ... because you've fallen in love    with him.
Where're you going?
Back where I belong.
It's composed of ultritium resin.
Which means it's doubtful the   Cardassian sensors will pick it   up. Of course, there's always a   chance...
You let me worry about that.
You sound like you've done this   before.
You'd be surprised.
Remember, the bomb is set to go off    three minutes after it's been    activated. And once it's activated,    it can't be disarmed. So make sure    you have enough time to get away.
How large a blast radius are we    talking about?
Twenty meters. I suggest you    plant it somewhere in Dukat's    quarters.
I'll pick the right spot.
What about that Bajoran mistress    of his?
What about her?
You can't risk telling her what    you're doing -- not even to save    her life.
Why would I? Like you said, she's    a collaborator. She deserves    whatever she gets.
I'm beginning to find you very    tiresome.
I don't like you either. Now, I    need you to take me to see Kira Meru.
I have better things to do than    shuttle you around this station.    It's time you decided which side    of this gate you want to be on.
I have. Now take me to Kira so    I can apologize to her.
Guard.
A wise decision.
I didn't expect to see you again.
I came because I owe you an   apology. Those things I said...   they were unfair.       I'd like us to be friends again.
So would I.
Whatever pleases you, my dear.
Can I get you something?
Maybe later.
First thing we're going to have    to do is find you some new    quarters -- something close-by.
Sounds good.
Here's a copy of the transmission    you requested.
Thank you, Basso. That'll be all.
What about her?
Don't concern yourself with Luma.    (patting Kira on the    shoulder)   She's not going to give us any   more trouble. Are you?
That's not what I'm here for.
No, it isn't.        Find her some quarters.
Right away.
This is for you. I think you'll    find it very interesting. I'll    be in my study if you need me.
I'd better go see about my quarters.
Meru... I hope the Cardassians    aren't lying to me --
-- and that they really will send   this message to you.

I know it's only been a few weeks    that we've been back home, but you    should see the children. It's    like they've been transformed.    Reon and Pohl are laughing and    playing together -- they've never    been happier. And I swear, little    Nerys must've gained five pounds.        Of course they keep asking for    you... I've told them you're still    at the refugee center. I think    that's best, at least for the time    being.        I can't believe how much I miss    you. I think about you all the    time. You've saved all our    lives... I hope you realize that.
Never forget it -- not even for    an instant.

Every day I pray to the Prophets    that you'll find some peace in    this new life of yours... I    believe that even in the worst of    times, we can still find moments    of joy and kindness. If you can    find that kindness, hold on to it.
And remember, no matter what    happens... I love you, Meru.
I'll always love you.
We've got to get out of here.
Why?
Dukat! Get out here -- now!
Go!
What is all this?
There's a bomb.
Meru!

I've always hated collaborators.        After all, what could be worse    than betraying your own people?    During the occupation, if I ever    had doubts about what their fate    should be... all I had to do was    think of my mother and how she    gave her life for Bajor. She was    a hero -- they were traitors. It    was as simple as that.       Or so I thought...
She did what she had to do to save    her family -- to save you.
It still doesn't make it right.
Maybe not, but it was her decision    to make.

I did some checking... my mother    died in a Cardassian hospital    seven years after meeting Dukat.         They were together seven years.    Do you know how many Bajorans died    in labor camps during that time?    Died while my mother sat sipping    kanar with Dukat...
Tell me something, Nerys... if you    hate her that much, why did you    save her life?
Believe me, there's a part of me    that wishes I hadn't. But the    fact is, no matter what she had    done... she was still my mother.
